queryLayers.name: Ground Water Protection Zones
queryLayers.description: Drinking Water Source Protection zones for ground-water sources.
queryLayers.heading: Drinking Water
queryLayers.NAME: FACNAME
queryLayers.codedValues: TYPE: 1 (100 foot fixed radius (closest, most critical)), 2 (250 day travel time (bacteria, virus viability)), 3 (3 year travel time (waiver criteria zone for VOCs and pesticides)), 4 (15 year travel time (Planning))

queryLayers.name: Source Water Assessment Zones
queryLayers.description: Source Water Assessment zones for sources in transient non-community systems.
queryLayers.heading: Drinking Water
queryLayers.NAME: FACNAME
queryLayers.codedValues: TYPE: 2 (250 day travel time (most critical)), 4 (15 year travel time)

queryLayers.name: Surface Water Protection Zones
queryLayers.description: Drinking Water Source Protection zones for surface-water sources.
queryLayers.heading: Drinking Water
queryLayers.NAME: FACNAME
queryLayers.codedValues: TYPE: 1 (Buffer from intake to 15 miles upstream (most critical)), 2 (From zone 1 to 65 miles upstream), 3 (From zone 2 to boundary of watershed), 4 (Remaining area of watershed outside of zones 1-3)

queryLayers.name: Irrigated Crop Consumptive Use Zones
queryLayers.description: Irrigated crop consumptive use zones for calculating drinking water source sizing. See Utah Administrative Code R309-510-7(3).
queryLayers.heading: Drinking Water
queryLayers.NAME: n/a

Need more' (3:Insufficient Data. Need more), ASSESSMENT = '4A/4C:Approved TMDL. Impaired' (4A/4C:Approved TMDL. Impaired), ASSESSMENT = '4A:Approved TMDL. Impaired' (4A:Approved TMDL. queryLayers.name: Monitoring Locations

queryLayers.NAME: NAME
queryLayers.specialFilters: field: AWQMS_TYPE|text (Type), Canal Drainage (water (excess) conveyance away from area of use), Canal Irrigation (water used for crop irrigation), Canal Transport (water in-route to area of use), Facility Other (industrial/municipal facility discharge to state waters), Lake (natural lake water), Mine/Mine Discharge (water sample within or discharging from a mine), Other-Ground Water (groundwater sample), River/Stream (water from river/stream bed), Seep (water sample from a seep), Spring (water sample form a spring), Storm Sewer (storm drain water sample location), Waste Sewer (sewer system water sample location), Well (water well sample site), Wetland Undifferentiated (impounded or natural wetland sample)

queryLayers.specialFilters: field: PermitType|text (Permit Type), Biosolids (de-watered sewage sludge composting), Concentrated Animal Feeding Operation (concentrated animal feeding operation (dairy or feedlot)), Coal Mine (coal mining and processing), Construction De-watering (construction site de-watering (usually groundwater)), Construction Stormwater (storm water discharge at a construction site), EPA Permit (discharge permits issued by EPA), Fish Hatchery (fish propagation operations ), General Permit (general permit), General Permit Pesticides (pesticide application), Industrial (discharge from industrial/production processes), Industrial Stormwater (storm water discharge from industrial facility), Municipal (public-owned wastewater treatment facility discharge), Municipal Stormwater (storm water discharge from city storm drains), Water Supply and Irrigation (culinary water processing discharges)

queryLayers.name: UPDES Storm Water
queryLayers.description: Locations of permitted Storm Water Dischargers (storm water from construction, industrial, muncipal sources) .
queryLayers.heading: Water Quality
queryLayers.NAME: Permittee
queryLayers.specialFilters: field: PermitType|text (Permit Type), Construction Stormwater (storm water discharge at a construction site), Industrial Stormwater (storm water discharge from industrial facility), Municipal Stormwater (MS4: storm water discharge from city storm drains)

queryLayers.specialFilters: field: WellStatus|text (Well Status), NEW (New Application for Permit to Drill (APD) Deepen or Re‐enter ‐ received but not yet approved), RET (New Application for Permit to Drill (APD) Deepen or Re‐enter ‐ Returned UNAPPROVED), APD (Approved Permit to Drill Deepen or Re‐enter), LA (Location Abandoned ‐ Approved Permit to Drill (APD) for a NEW well ‐ Rescinded ‐ no site disturbance), CP (Cancelled Permit ‐ Approved Permit to Deepen or Re‐enter (APD) an EXISTING well), DRL (Well Spudded and/or currently Drilling), OPS (Drilling Operations Suspended ‐ spudded but no drilling activity for an extended period ‐ well not yet completed), P (Producing oil or gas well (OW or GW)), S (Shut‐in oil or gas well (OW or GW)), PAI (Producing oil or gas zone or lateral AND Active Injection zone or lateral (well types: OWI and GWI and OGI and GGI and GWD)), PII (Producing oil or gas zone or lateral AND Inactive Injection zone or lateral (well types: OWI and GWI and OGI and GGI and GWD)), SAI (Shut‐in oil or gas zone or lateral AND Active Injection zone or lateral (well types: OWI and GWI and OGI and GGI and GWD)), SII (Shut‐in oil or gas zone or lateral AND Inactive Injection zone or lateral (well types: OWI and GWI and OGI and GGI and GWD)), TA (Temporarily‐Abandoned oil or gas well), A (Active service well (well types: WI and WD and GI and GS and WS and TW)), I (Inactive service well (well types: WI and WD and GI and GS and WS and TW)), C (Cancelled Sundry (Well History Only) ‐ Work proposed on Sundry of Intent later cancelled before work begins), PA (Any well or construct permanently Plugged and Abandoned); field: WellType|text (Well Type), OW (Oil well ‐ capable of producing oil in substantial quantities.), GW (Natural Gas well ‐ capable of producing natural gas in substantial quantities and is not an oil well.), OGW (Combined Oil and Gas well ‐ producing oil from one lateral or zone and gas from another.), CBM (Coalbed Methane well ‐ a gas well that produces from coalbeds and rock strata associated with coalbed.), CO2 (Carbon Dioxide well.), HE (Helium well.), OWI (Oil Well/Water Injection Well (capable of alternating functions in a single wellbore OR capable of producing in one well bore while injecting in another bore). Well is to be reported on both Form 10 Monthly Production Report and UIC Form 2 Monthly Report of Enhanced Recovery Project with appropriate statuses.), GWI (Gas Well/Water Injection Well (capable of alternating functions in a single wellbore OR capable of producing in one well bore while injecting in another bore). Well is to be reported on both Form 10 Monthly Production Report and UIC Form 2 Monthly Report of Enhanced Recovery Project with appropriate statuses.), OGI (Oil Well/Gas Injection Well (capable of alternating functions in a single wellbore OR capable of producing in one well bore while injecting in another bore). Well is to be reported on both Form 10 Monthly Production Report and UIC Form 2 Monthly Report of Enhanced Recovery Project with appropriate statuses.), GGI (Gas Well/Gas Injection Well (capable of alternating functions in a single wellbore OR capable of producing in one well bore while injecting in another bore). Well is to be reported on both Form 10 Monthly Production Report and UIC Form 2 Monthly Report of Enhanced Recovery Project with appropriate statuses.), GWD (Gas Well/Water Disposal Well (capable of alternating functions in a single wellbore OR capable of producing in one well bore while injecting in another bore). Well is to be reported on both Form 10 Monthly Production Report and UIC Form 3 Monthly Injection Report with appropriate statuses.), WI (Water Injection well (service well).), WD (Water Disposal well (service well).), GI (Gas Injection well (service well).), GS (Gas Storage well (service well).), WS (Water Source well (service well).), TW (Test Well (service well ‐ strat test/core test/monitor well/etc.).), D (Dry Hole (well never produced oil or natural gas in paying quantities).), NA (Well Type Not Available or known (old PA wells).)
